name: Deep-Fried Onion Rings
author: Elle
summary: Bermuda onions are covered in a buttermilk batter and deep-fried. Can be reheated in a warm oven to serve.
ingredients: 3 large Bermuda onions, sliced into 1/3-inch rings
2 cups corn oil, or as needed
directions: Soak onion rings in a bowl of ice water for 1 hour; drain and pat dry with paper towels
Whisk flour, buttermilk, egg, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl until smooth
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Dip onion rings in batter, working in batches; fry battered onion rings in the hot oil until browned, about 5 minutes
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate
